pageContext.claim: “Human trafficking cannot be stopped if we don't have a steel barrier or a concrete wall -- something very powerful. It cannot be stopped.”
pageContext.analysis: Without minimizing the human trafficking problem, proportionally speaking, it's hard to top the slave trade in the time of the American colonies. Though human trafficking is a major issue in some regions of the world, experts and available evidence indicate trafficking for sexual exploitation is not a serious problem in the United States.
